conversations.conversation:
Hello everyone, I’m Virginia, a mother of 3 lovely lads. Alex, the eldest is 20, Carlo, 16, and Robert, 13. When my youngest son Robert enters High School, my husband gives him a car. It’s kinda bit old but having a car when you’re still a high school can give you a boost to your personality. But that’s not the reason why we give him a car. The main reason is that our house is a little bit far from their school. And we don’t want him to get late and even don’t want him to take a bus going home.
;
;We went to a ;dealership; nearby and agreed that a 2005 Toyota Camry is suited for my son. It may not be as luxurious as a Porsche or a BMW but it was nice and comfy enough to ride and what’s more great about the car was that it still had some few months warranty left from the original owner of the car. We don’t have enough money at that time for the down payment but fortunately the dealership that we went to has many connections with different lenders and ;financing institutions; . By the next few days, after we submitted our requirements, we received a call from one of their sales representatives telling us that our car loan had been approved and our ;Toyota Camry; is ready for pick-up at their dealership.
;
;;;;
;
;The first 2 weeks from the time we bought the car, my son seems to like the car and arrived at home early. By the third week, he started to come home late at night. Much worst on the fourth week, he came home around 2:00 AM drunk and wasted. We wonder how he managed to drive home safely. The next morning we sat with him during breakfast and told him to always be careful and don’t drink too much specially that he was driving.
;
;After a week from the time we scolded him, he began to be a saint again. He came home early, slept early, and finished his assignments flawlessly. But 2 weeks after, we were all in shocked when he arrived at our house with blood on his head. The side mirrors of the car were missing and the headlights were all broken. Then my husband said, “Oh no, we can’t have the insurance if he’s under the influence of alcohol again”. We rushed my son at the nearest hospital to cure his wounds. Good thing that it was all just minor injuries. Another good thing was that he was not drunk or had been drinking alcohol at that time. He told us that on the way home, a group of kids with stones in their hands blocked the high way. After a few minutes, the kids started to throw stones all over the car and he got hit by one of the stones when an area of the windshield was broken.
;
;Right there and then we reported it at the police station, called the insurance company and told them everything that happened to the car. The next morning an insurance agent came to our house, interviewed us and investigated the incident. After 2 weeks they found out that what happened to my son was really a road accident and therefore they gave the insurance money due for us. I hope my experience will give importance to the insurance available for the used cars. If a ;dealership; can give you or can transfer the insurance from the first owner of the car then that dealership really is a trusted one.
